{
  "2.  We need to ask Jeff Hodge for his opinion with respect to NCPA transacting a deal of this tenor.  There are sometimes tenor limits placed on municipal entities to limit the term under which they are authorized to transact.  Jeff": "How do we research this issue?  NCPA has provided us a brief statement that indicates that \"NCPA will work expeditiously to execute a definitive contract and has all the necessary approval authorities\", but my feeling is that we need something a little more substantial than that.",
  "3.  Kelli": "Have you spoken with Global Finance to price the embedded loan in this deal?",
  "4.  Kim": "I don't think a credit reserve will be needed on this deal.",
  "5.  Kim": "From the document that NCPA sent out, it appears that your Monday bid is preliminary and conditional.  We need to make sure that NCPA understands our requirements with respect to executing a Master.  Can your contact at NCPA help me get a copy of their latest financials so we can expedite that process?",
  "6.  Kim": "ONE VERY IMPORTANT NOTE:  NCPA's credit ratings have remained solid throughout the California power crisis, for a number of reasons.  As such, I am pretty comfortable moving forward with this deal, given the above requirements.  However, if their financial results indicate some problems, we may need to include some stringent credit requirements in the Master.  I'm pretty sure that their results will look good, but this is a contingency to bear in mind as your prepare your bid.",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Sat, 20 Oct 2001 11:43:32 -0700 (PDT)",
  "From": "credit \u003c.williams@enron.com\u003e",
  "I have taken a look at the Northern California Power Agency deal, and it looks pretty good from a credit standpoint.  We currently have some exposure to NCPA on the power side, but it rolls off by the end of the year, so I think that we can still get this deal done.  Some outstanding issues": "",

  "2.  We need to ask Jeff Hodge for his opinion with respect to NCPA transacting a deal of this tenor.  There are sometimes tenor limits placed on municipal entities to limit the term under which they are authorized to transact.  Jeff": "How do we research this issue?  NCPA has provided us a brief statement that indicates that \"NCPA will work expeditiously to execute a definitive contract and has all the necessary approval authorities\", but my feeling is that we need something a little more substantial than that.",
  "3.  Kelli": "Have you spoken with Global Finance to price the embedded loan in this deal?",
  "4.  Kim": "I don't think a credit reserve will be needed on this deal.",
  "5.  Kim": "From the document that NCPA sent out, it appears that your Monday bid is preliminary and conditional.  We need to make sure that NCPA understands our requirements with respect to executing a Master.  Can your contact at NCPA help me get a copy of their latest financials so we can expedite that process?",
  "6.  Kim": "ONE VERY IMPORTANT NOTE:  NCPA's credit ratings have remained solid throughout the California power crisis, for a number of reasons.  As such, I am pretty comfortable moving forward with this deal, given the above requirements.  However, if their financial results indicate some problems, we may need to include some stringent credit requirements in the Master.  I'm pretty sure that their results will look good, but this is a contingency to bear in mind as your prepare your bid.",
  "Bcc": "eric.moon@enron.com, loftus.fitzwater@enron.com",
  "Cc": "",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Sun, 21 Oct 2001 09:15:24 -0700 (PDT)",
  "From": "Williams, Jason R (Credit)",
  "I have taken a look at the Northern California Power Agency deal, and it looks pretty good from a credit standpoint.  We currently have some exposure to NCPA on the power side, but it rolls off by the end of the year, so I think that we can still get this deal done.  Some outstanding issues": "",

  "Sent": "Thursday, October 25, 2001 2:41 PM",
  "Subject": "Andy \u0026 Jeff:",
  "To": "Edison, Andrew",
  "We have scheduled a conference call on Oct. 30 (Tuesday) at 3": "00 p.m. with the Judge to discuss setting the motion to transfer for hearing and our request that oral testimony be allowed.  TDC will oppose this request.  If the request is granted, they will ask to depose anyone who is called.  Frankly, if they do not need further discovery to prepare a reply, I don't understand why they would need discovery to have a hearing.  Nonetheless, the judge will make that call.",

{
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Core": "Wholesale energy business in North America and Europe, retail energy, pipelines",
  "Date": "Wed, 14 Nov 2001 13:43:37 -0800 (PST)",
  "Enron's business has been grouped into three buckets": "Core, Non-core, and Under Review.",
  "From": "Tucker, Patrick",
  "McMahon": "\"The company is overlevered; that's a fact.\"--hence our pursuit of additional equity.",
  "McMahon described the major off-balance-sheet vehicles": "",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c2577438.1075861580530.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Non-core": "Broadband, water, and international assets (i.e. EGAS).  Enron has approx. $8Bn in investments in these assets, and they have produced 'dismal' returns.  Enron will be exiting these businesses and will attempt to wind them up in an orderly fashion.  An aggressive divestiture program has been set in motion for these assets.",
  "Sent": "Wednesday, November 14, 2001 11:44 AM",
  "Subject": "Highlights from ENE Analyst Conference Call 11/14",

  "CONTACT": "John A. Cote at ext. 33830",
  "Carmen, June 8-10, 2001 @ 8": "30pm nightly",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Cover Charge": "Minimum $5 Donation",
  "Date": "Fri, 1 Jun 2001 15:00:48 -0700 (PDT)",
  "Day": "Thursdays",
  "For More Info": "call 5-6528",
  "For more information about The Voices of Enron, contact Melinda Pharms, Vice President, of Education via e-mail at \u003cmpharms@ect.enron.com\u003e or by phone at 713/853-3866 - Internal Extension 33866 or Kathy Willard, Vice President, Membership at kwillar@enron.com \u003cmailto": "kwillar@enron.com\u003e, phone No. 713/646-7341 - Internal Extension 67341",
  "Friday afternoon (3": "00 - 6:00pm), July 13 through Sunday afternoon, July 15",
  "From": "40enron@enron.com",
  "HOW": "Share all sports activities, including canoeing, hiking, fishing, organizing a talent \t\t\tshow/bonfire/ghost stories, obstacle course, water balloon fights, softball, \t\t\t\tbasketball, archery, football, etc.  (Cooking and clean-up covered by the Houston Boys \u0026 \t\tGirls Club staff.)",
  "Houston Grand Opera's sensational Multimedia Modular Stage production returns for three FREE performances at Houston's Miller Outdoor Theatre on June 8-10 at 8": "30 p.m. Bizet's fiery gypsy Carmen, everybody's favorite femme fatale, ignites the summer in a powerhouse production that had audiences and critics cheering when it was first unveiled in 1998.",
  "If interested please contact LaShabriel Keys at 713.546.0283 or lkeys@houstongrandopera.org.  Check-in for volunteers will be at 6": "30pm nightly at the Volunteer Information Tent near the Miller Outdoor Theatre stage.",
  "Join the Enron Running Club at the Dad's Day 5K and 1 Mile Family Walk benefiting The Prostate Cancer Research and Awareness scheduled for Saturday, June 2nd.  If you're interested in running or volunteering your time, please contact Cindy Richardson at 713-853-4770 or Kelly Lombardi at 713-345-5841.  For more information, run to": "http://home.enron.com:84/erc/index.html.",
  "Kevin Hannon, Boys \u0026 Girls Club board member, invites you to join Enron employee John Cote at a Boys \u0026 Girls Club summer camp. John and Kevin are looking for commitments from some dedicated ENRON men \u0026 women. SPREAD THE WORD - SPOUSES, FRIENDS \u0026 OFFICE COLLEAGUES WELCOME - LAST YEAR'S CAMP WAS A HUGE SUCCESS! Details below": "",
  "Location": "Enron Building",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c14457951.1075845170415.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Please email Jennifer Milligan if you are interested in volunteering and indicate your preference in the below activities": "",
  "Please join Jeff Skilling at a press conference today at 10": "30 a.m. in Antioch Park to announce The United Way Scholars Program!  Your contribution is helping to provide 50 local high school students with college scholarships and funding for middle and high school technology programs designed to reach thousands of students each year!",
  "Subject": "Enron In Action 06.04.01",
  "The Enron Running Club is seeking runners, sprinters, discus \u0026 shot put throwers, high jumpers and long jumpers to compete in the annual USCAA Track \u0026 Field Championships on Saturday, June 9th at Rice University.  Participate in co-ed track relays \u0026 field events for all ages and abilities; showcase your energy and talents in a challenging, competitive, and fun environment; participate in an Enron tradition since 1994; experience teambuilding and camaraderie like never before!  For more information or to sign up, contact Cindy Richardson at x3-4770 or sprint to": "http://home.enron.com:84/erc/index.html",
  "Tickets for the reserved seating will be issued between the hours of 11": "30am and 1:00pm through the Miller Theatre box office on the day of the performance.  Any remaining tickets will be issued one hour before the performance.",
  "Time": "11:30 a.m. - 12:30 p.m.",
  "United Way Scholars Press Conference, Today at 10": "30 AM!!!!",

{
  "6-10 Day Bottom Line": "Variable conditions continue with a stormy pattern entrenched over much of the nation. Overall temperatures will be normal to cool with very wet conditions. NO strong Arctic air is expected.",
  "Bottom line": "No Changes - Overall US conditions will return to a more normal late fall/early winter pattern (no Arctic air) over the next 2 days. This pattern will persist through the end of the month.",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Sun, 18 Nov 2001 06:03:52 -0800 (PST)",
  "Details": "A strong storm will push into the West late next week and next weekend bringing heavy rain and snow and temperatures near to below normal. At the same time - the Midwest will warm toward normal with wet conditions developing. By early in the last week of November the strong western storm will push into the central U.S. bringing widespread rain and snow. Behind the system another surge of below normal temperatures will track from the Midwest to the South to the East.",
  "For the near term (1-5)": "Bottom Line - Cooler weather will bring temperatures below normal from the beginning through the middle of the week in the Midwest and from the middle through the end of the week in the East and South. The below normal event will last 3 to 4 days before normal temperatures return. The Rockies and West will be normal to above normal with cooling by the end of the week.",
  "From": "a..roberts@enron.com",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c7875269.1075861695553.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "So, with normals dropping across the nation, this first cool air anomaly event arriving in the Midwest by Tuesday will elevate the nation's gas demand requirements into the 60 Bcf/d plus regime from here on through the winter. Here's the strip beginning with today": "",

  "Can't make the live event?  No worries.  Go to eSpeak (http": "//ethink.enron.com/eSpeak/exec/default.asp) now and submit your question.  Sharon will try to answer it during her event and you can read the transcript later.",

  "Rental car contracts for 2001 have been awarded to": "",
  "Subject": "Enron Announcement",
  "To": "ena.employees@enron.com",
  "To enjoy the highest levels of service while renting a vehicle from Enron's preferred suppliers, it is recommended that each traveler enroll in National's and Alamo's preferred traveler programs.  National's Emerald Club membership and Alamo's Quicksilver program are designed to speed the transaction time by providing services such as counter bypass and rapid return.  The enrollment fees for these programs have been waived for Enron travelers.  Enrollment packets will be mailed to the addresses of Enron American Express T\u0026E Cardholders.  You may also find an enrollment form on the Enron Travel Program intranet @ gss.enron.com \u003chttp": "//gss.enron.com/\u003e.",
  "When you rent a vehicle in the United States, (including Puerto Rico) or Canada, the following insurance provisions are included, regardless of rate selected": "",

{
  "Bcc": "david.fairley@enron.com, john.hodge@enron.com, jennifer.bagwell@enron.com,",
  "Cc": "david.fairley@enron.com, john.hodge@enron.com, jennifer.bagwell@enron.com,",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Wed, 18 Apr 2001 17:39:00 -0700 (PDT)",
  "FGT Deadline": "It is my understanding that FGT needs to finalize the Phase VI plans by April 30, 2001.",
  "From": "mathew.gimble@enron.com",
  "Hourly Gas Requirements": "even though we have reviewed various turbine configurations, the amount of hourly gas needed for this project has managed to hover around 2,100mmbtu/hr using 16 hour/day run cycles.",
  "Looping vs Lateral": "we are willing to defer to FGT's recommendation provided that a single meter configuration be used as opposed to a dual configuration.",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c8568173.1075845173017.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Phase VI Strategy": "the plan has been to either get this construction rolled into the Phase VI expansion (it would be the first piece of Phase VI initiated in order to meet our time deadline) or to have the construction covered by FGT's blanket for normal construction.",
  "Pressure Requirements": "per the Mitsubishi 501F technical specs, required pressure at the inlet is 530psi, however, this does not include losses.  Therefore, the required pressure off of FGT's mainline needs to be 560psi.",
  "Subject": "Fort Pierce Pipeline Requirements",
  "Timing": "plans are for the plant to be running in a simple-cycle configuration by June '02 and a combined-cycle configuration by Sep '02.  Therefore, we will need pipeline construction completed by Apr '02 for start-up and testing.",
  "To": "ruth.concannon@enron.com",
  "Welcome to the Fort Pierce Repowering Project, aka \"FPRP\", (now that John has become a traitor err trader).  The following list contains the latest and greatest natural gas needs for this project (if anyone copied notices any discrepancies with my information, I need to know yesterday \u003c- that soon)": "",
  "X-FileName": "Hodge, John.pst",
  "X-Folder": "\\Hodge, John\\Hodge, John\\Inbox",
  "X-From": "Mathew Gimble \u003cMathew Gimble/HOU/ECT@ECT\u003e",
  "X-Origin": "HODGE-J",
  "X-To": "Ruth Concannon \u003cRuth Concannon/HOU/ECT@ECT\u003e",
  "X-bcc": "",
  "X-cc": "David Fairley \u003cDavid Fairley/Enron@EnronXGate\u003e, John Hodge \u003cJohn Hodge/Corp/Enron@ENRON\u003e, Jennifer Bagwell \u003cJennifer Bagwell/Enron@EnronXGate\u003e, Bruce Golden \u003cBruce Golden/ENRON_DEVELOPMENT@ENRON_DEVELOPMENT\u003e, Darrell Stovall \u003cDarrell Stovall/NA/Enron@Enron\u003e"
}

  "Date": "Fri, 18 May 2001 14:57:23 -0700 (PDT)",
  "From": "40enron@enron.com",
  "In an effort to protect Enron's e-mail system from harmful viruses, the Global Messaging Team has implemented an inbound and outbound cluster of MAILSweeper servers. What does that mean to you, the user? All inbound and outbound Internet mail is passed through a set of servers that will scan each message for viruses, malicious code, business related-content and inappropriate content. Inbound Internet mail that contains the following attachment types will be quarantined (held for delivery)": "*.vbs, *.exe, *.com, *.bat, *.cmd. If you are the intended recipient of one of these e-mails, you will receive an automatic notification with instructions on how to get your legitimate e-mail released from quarantine.",

{

  "05/09/2001 05": "14 PM",
  "Bcc": "cynthia.franklin@enron.com",
  "Cc": "cynthia.franklin@enron.com",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Mon, 21 May 2001 14:48:39 -0700 (PDT)",
  "Enron North America Corp.  From": "Scott Dozier                           05/09/2001 04:46 PM",
  "From": "scott.dozier@enron.com",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c25276355.1075845173295.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Overview": "I am still unclear as to what recallable means.  It sounds from your note below and everything that Cindy has told me, that by recall you simply mean a buy back or back-to-back as it resides within our system.  However, Colonial is not billing or settling it that way.  They are wanting to collect on their sale for these items while considering our sales for these as never having flowed.  Unless, I am missing something from your conversations with Colonial their may be a disconnect with them.",

  "Subject": "Online Launch Plan Update",
  "The Splash page will look something like the following": "",
  "To": "traders.dl-netco@enron.com, originators.dl-netco@enron.com,",
  "UBSWenergy Marketing Contacts": "",
  "We will distribute a packet to each of the Originators/Traders who have volounteered to call customers and assist in getting signed Password Applications. The packets will contain": "",
  "Week of Feb. 11": "",
  "Week of Feb. 4": "",
  "Week of Jan 28": "",

{
  "CONTACT": "John A. Cote at ext. 33830",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Mon, 28 May 2001 18:52:41 -0700 (PDT)",
  "For more information please contact": "",
  "Friday afternoon (3": "00 - 6:00pm), July 13 through Sunday afternoon, July 15",
  "From": "40enron@enron.com",
  "HOW": "Share all sports activities, including canoeing, hiking, fishing, organizing a talent \t\t\tshow/bonfire/ghost stories, obstacle course, water balloon fights, softball, basketball, \t\tarchery, football, etc.  (Cooking and clean-up covered by the Houston Boys Club staff.)",
  "Join the Enron Running Club at the Dad's Day 5K and 1 Mile Family Walk benefiting The Prostate Cancer Research and Awareness scheduled for Saturday, June 2nd.  If you're interested in running or volunteering your time, please contact Cindy Richardson at 713-853-4770 or Kelly Lombardi at 713-345-5841.  For more information, run to": "http://home.enron.com:84/erc/index.html.",
  "Join the Enron Running Club at the Heights Fun Run 5K benefiting The Houston Heights Association's Community Projects scheduled for Saturday, June 2nd.  If you're interested in running or volunteering your time, please contact Cindy Richardson at 713-853-4770 or Kelly Lombardi at 713-345-5841.  For more information, run to": "http://home.enron.com:84/erc/index.html.",
  "Kevin Hannon, Boys \u0026 Girls Club board member, invites you to join Enron employee John Cote at a Boys \u0026 Girls Club summer camp who is looking for commitment from a FEW GOOD ENRON MEN AND WOMEN": "",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c3863381.1075845173627.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Please email Jennifer Milligan if you are interested in volunteering and indicate your preference in the below activities": "",
  "Subject": "Enron In Action 05.29.01",
  "The Enron Running Club is seeking runners, sprinters, discus \u0026 shot put throwers, and high jumpers \u0026 long jumpers to compete in the annual USCAA Track \u0026 Field Championships on Saturday, June 9th at Rice University.  Participate in co-ed track relays \u0026 field events of all ages and abilities; showcase your energy and talents in a challenging, competitive, and fun environment; participate in an Enron tradition since 1994; experience teambuilding and camaraderie like never before!  For more information or to sign up, contact Cindy Richardson at x3-4770 or sprint to": "http://home.enron.com:84/erc/index.html",
  "To register, log on to": "http://www.kidventurecamp.com/camp_enron.htm.   Spaces are limited.",
  "WHAT": "2nd Annual Houston Boys and Girls Club / Enron Summer Camp Weekend (2 camps)",
  "WHEN": "Boys Camp",
  "WHERE": "Willis, TX (75 minutes from downtown Houston -- just north of Conroe)",
  "WHO": "6-8 counselors per camp to chaperone 75 boys (ages 7-16)",
  "X-FileName": "Hodge, John.pst",
  "X-Folder": "\\Hodge, John\\Hodge, John\\Inbox",
  "X-From": "Enron In Action@ENRON \u003cIMCEANOTES-Enron+20In+20Action+40ENRON@ENRON.com\u003e",
  "X-Origin": "HODGE-J",
  "X-To": "All Enron Houston@ENRON \u003c??SAll Enron Houston@ENRON\u003e",
  "X-bcc": "",
  "X-cc": "",
  "call Kidventure": "713.960.8989",
  "e-mail": "camps@kidventurecamp.com",
  "http": "//home.enron.com:84/messaging/siggoldcourses.pdf",
  "no later than 12": "00 noon the Thursday prior to the next Monday's mailing.",
  "web site": "www.kidventurecamp.com"
}

{
  "Americas": "IBIT increased 31% to $701 million.  Natural gas volumes increased 6% to 26.7 Tbtu/d, and power volumes increased 77% to 290 million megawatt hours (MWh).",
  "Broadband Services": "IBIT losses were $(80) million in the current quarter compared to a $(20) million loss last year.  This quarter's results include significantly lower investment-related income and lower operating costs.",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=ANSI_X3.4-1968",
  "Corporate and other": "This segment includes the unallocated expenses associated with general corporate functions. This segment reported an IBIT loss of $(59) million compared to $(106) million a year ago.",
  "Date": "Tue, 16 Oct 2001 07:25:35 -0700 (PDT)",
  "Europe and Other Commodity Markets": "IBIT remained unchanged at $53 million as compared to last year.  While physical gas and power volumes increased, low volatility in these markets caused profitability to remain flat.",
  "Following are the highlights of our businesses": "",
  "From": "no.address@enron.com",
  "Global Assets": "This segment includes Elektro, Dabhol, TGS, Azurix and Enron Wind.  Third quarter IBIT remained unchanged at $19 million compared to last year.",
  "In addition, this quarter we announced one-time charges of $1.01 billion.  Over the past few quarters, we have conducted a thorough  review of our businesses and have decided to take certain charges to clear away issues that have clouded the performance and earnings potential  of our core businesses.  These charges include": "",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c4669367.1075852749613.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Natural Gas Pipelines": "IBIT increased slightly to $85 million in the third quarter.",
  "Portland General": "We reported an IBIT loss of $(17) million this quarter compared to IBIT of $74 million a year ago.  This loss is due to power contracts PGE entered into at prices that were significantly higher than actual settled prices during the third quarter.  Last week, we  announced an agreement to sell PGE to Northwest Natural.  This transaction is expected to close next year.",
  "Retail Services": "Enron Energy Services reported IBIT of $71 million, compared to $27 million a year ago.  So far this year, EES has completed more than 50 transactions with large customers and more than 95,000 deals with small business customers.",
  "Subject": "Third Quarter Earnings Results",
  "Transportation and Distribution": "",
  "Wholesale Services": "Total income before interest, minority interests and taxes (IBIT) increased 28% to $754 million in the third quarter.  Total wholesale physical volumes increased 65% to 88.2 trillion British thermal units equivalent per day (Tbtue/d).",
  "With our announcements this quarter we accomplished three things": "1) we showed continued strong earnings and earnings growth in our core businesses, 2) we cleared away those things that were clouding this superb performance in our core businesses, and 3) We expanded our reporting of financial results to increase transparency for our investors.   "---\tWe will do a better job providing you with timely information about issues affecting Enron.  In addition to our existing communication efforts, like e-mail messages and internal publications eBiz and Enron Business, we will post a Q\u0026A on current issues on the Enron intranet at home.enron.com \u003chttp": "//home.enron.com\u003e.  This will give us a consistent message across the organization and will equip you with information when talking to your customers.",
  "1.\tPeople (the high quality of people at Enron was the most widely-cited aspect)": "",
  "2.\tCulture and reputation": "",
  "3.\tWork environment": "",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Tue, 2 Oct 2001 14:24:19 -0700 (PDT)",
  "From": "40enron@enron.com",
  "I.  We asked you to identify the top five issues facing Enron today.  The responses were": "",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c25664132.1075852751569.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Subject": "Lay It On the Line Survey Results",
  "Therefore, we will make the following changes to the PRC process prior to year-end": "",
  "We all recognize that our external reputation has suffered this year.  The single most important factor that influences our reputation is our actions - how we act and how we communicate those actions as a company and as individual employees.  We recognize that as Enron's ambassador's in the marketplace, the more you know about our strategy, performance and challenges, the more you can help disseminate accurate information about our company.  To ensure you are better informed": "",
  "We also want to make sure that employees know what we are doing going forward": "",
  "We are all concerned about our stock price, which has declined significantly this year.  The primary reasons for the sharp decline from our highs earlier this year include": "",

  "Reporting to me as the heads of their respective business units are": "",
  "Subject": "Organization Changes",
  "This reorganization will allow EGS to focus our resources on opportunities that present the highest value to Enron.  It will also accomplish the following": "1) enhanced synergies among our assets and personnel, 2) more effective prioritization of business opportunities, and 3) better management of Enron's asset-based businesses throughout the world.",
  "With the creation of EGS, we hope to enhance the efficient utilization of our commercial support services.  To accomplish this, EGS' staff and operational functions will be headed by": "",

  "There are several new computer viruses that are spreading rapidly on the internet.   "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Tue, 6 Nov 2001 09:01:37 -0800 (PST)",
  "Dear Patrick": "Yesterday I spoke with the Office of Conservation at the Louisiana Dept. of Natural Resources about the Crawfish Plant.  As you may recall from our phone conversation several weeks ago, we (LRCI, Inc.) have been assessed with a civil penalty for failure to file an R6 report in July.  La. faxed me a copy of the June report, and it shows a balance of 29 barrels of oil at the plant.  We can't close out the filings with the state until the R6 report shows a balance of zero barrels.",

  "From": "Rasmussen, Dale \u003cDale.Rasmussen@ENRON.com\u003e",
  "I had to do some follow-up research on the background to the earlier e-mail (which is still the high point of my day)": "",
  "In his 1940 book, The Gift to be Simple, Edward Deming Andrews described a song called \"The Hinkum-Booby\" that was sung by Shakers in Kentucky": "",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c20890674.1075861587080.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Sent": "Tue Nov 27 17:18:24 2001",
  "Subject": "Because the Hokey Pokey is more interesting than what we do for a living",
  "Tel": "(503) 464-8863",
  "There followed a steady succession of recordings": "Jack Johnson and the Hickory Dickory Singers, Warren Covington with the Tommy Dorsey Orchestra, Cliffie Stone, Jerry Marks, Chubby Checker, Annette Funicello, the Champs. {
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Tue, 18 Dec 2001 15:11:58 -0800 (PST)",
  "From": "chairman.enron@enron.com",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c24878889.1075840746596.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Subject": "Organizational Announcement",
  "The Creditors' Committee was formed last week by the United States Trustee.  This committee is comprised of 15 individuals representing various creditor groups including": "banks, bondholders, insurance companies and employees.  The Creditors' Committee will be the key point of contact as we reorganize the company and emerge from Chapter 11.  Initially, they will send financial advisors to our offices to monitor any asset liquidations as well as review our cash flow projections.  Ultimately, they will be responsible for approving our reorganization plan as to which assets or businesses we sell and which ones we retain.",
  "To": "dl-ga-all_enron_worldwide2@enron.com",
  "Unfortunately, due to the current financial condition of the company, the following members of the management committee have left the company or will be leaving the company by the end of December": "",
  "X-FileName": "john w hodge 6-26-02.pst",
  "X-Folder": "\\ExMerge - Hodge, John W.\\Inbox",

  "Based on information that we have recently obtained, Enron and its auditors determined that certain off-balance sheet entities should have been included in Enron's consolidated financial statements pursuant to generally accepted accounting principles.  As a result, Enron will restate its financial statements from 1997 to 2000 and for the first and second quarters of 2001.  These restatements have no material effect on Enron's current financial position.  Here are some details included in the filing": "",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Thu, 8 Nov 2001 15:35:50 -0800 (PST)",
  "From": "chairman.ken@enron.com",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c17157665.1075861698925.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Net income for each period will be impacted by the retroactive consolidation of Joint Energy Development Investments (JEDI) and Chewco beginning in November 1997, the consolidation of an LJM1 subsidiary for 1999 and 2000 and prior year proposed audit adjustments.  Enron's current assessment indicates that the restatement will include": "",
  "Subject": "SEC Information/Earnings Restatement",
  "The information provides further details about": "",

If you receive any calls from the media, please refer them to our media team at (713) 853-5670.",
  "Investors and security holders are urged to carefully read the joint proxy statement/prospectus regarding the proposed transactions when it becomes available, because it will contain important information.  Investors and security holders may obtain a free copy of the joint proxy statement/prospectus (when it is available) and other documents containing information about Dynegy and Enron, without charge, at the SEC's web site at www.sec.gov.   "Consolidation of trading activity": "Mid- and back-office consolidation will see substantial progress prior to closing, such that only the front office / trading books will need to be combined at closing.  EES, NNG and TW have no real overlap with existing DYN activity, so there won't be much integration work required there.  The big integration effort will be ENA.",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Mon, 12 Nov 2001 08:25:00 -0800 (PST)",
  "From": "patrick.tucker@enron.com",
  "Lay": "had the SPEs been capitalized with perhaps $30MM more of risk capital, there would have been no question that they would have qualified for off-balance-sheet treatment and there would have been no need to restate earnings last week to reflect consolidation of the SPEs.",

  "Core": "Wholesale energy business in North America and Europe, retail energy, pipelines",
  "Date": "Wed, 14 Nov 2001 09:44:01 -0800 (PST)",
  "Enron's business has been grouped into three buckets": "Core, Non-core, and Under Review.",
  "From": "patrick.tucker@enron.com",
  "McMahon": "\"The company is overlevered; that's a fact.\"--hence our pursuit of additional equity.",
  "McMahon described the major off-balance-sheet vehicles": "",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c8742572.1075861699361.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Non-core": "Broadband, water, and international assets (i.e. EGAS).  Enron has approx. $8Bn in investments in these assets, and they have produced 'dismal' returns.  Enron will be exiting these businesses and will attempt to wind them up in an orderly fashion.  An aggressive divestiture program has been set in motion for these assets.",
  "Subject": "Highlights from ENE Analyst Conference Call 11/14",
  "To": "s..pollan@enron.com, lindsay.culotta@enron.com, e.murrell@enron.com,",
  "Under Review": "EGM, EIM.  These businesses are being closely examined to determine whether they have a reasonable chance of long-term viability.  Required resource levels are being carefully studied.  Following review, Enron will move the different portions of these businesses to core or non-core as the analysis dictates.",

  "Subject": "Enron Center South Technology Watch",
  "Ten audio channels have been set up for access from your either your Avaya telephone, Stentophon, or IPC Turret.  The channels have been defined on Page 15 of your Turret.  To access the audio from either your Avaya or Stentophon, simply dial the extensions shown in the table below": "",
  "There are many NEC 50\" Plasma screens installed on the 5th and 6th floors.  While many of these will be displaying information designed for the specific unit, others will be displaying various television channels.  The audio to these television channels can be accessed via any of your telephony equipment.  Here's how": "",

  "After a careful review of the wholesale and retail gas trading and scheduling process it has been decided that the Gas Logistics teams should report directly into the Enron America's Commercial organization.   "Message-ID": "\u003c21415759.1075845172118.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Overview": "I am still unclear as to what recallable means.  It sounds from your note below and everything that Cindy has told me, that by recall you simply mean a buy back or back-to-back as it resides within our system.  However, Colonial is not billing or settling it that way.  They are wanting to collect on their sale for these items while considering our sales for these as never having flowed.  Unless, I am missing something from your conversations with Colonial their may be a disconnect with them.",

  "Overview": "I am still unclear as to what recallable means.  It sounds from your note below and everything that Cindy has told me, that by recall you simply mean a buy back or back-to-back as it resides within our system.  However, Colonial is not billing or settling it that way.  They are wanting to collect on their sale for these items while considering our sales for these as never having flowed.  Unless, I am missing something from your conversations with Colonial their may be a disconnect with them.",

  "Rental car contracts for 2001 have been awarded to": "",
  "Subject": "Enron Announcement",
  "To": "all.america@enron.com",
  "To enjoy the highest levels of service while renting a vehicle from Enron's preferred suppliers, it is recommended that each traveler enroll in National's and Alamo's preferred traveler programs.  National's Emerald Club membership and Alamo's Quicksilver program are designed to speed the transaction time by providing services such as counter bypass and rapid return.  The enrollment fees for these programs have been waived for Enron travelers.  Enrollment packets will be mailed to the addresses of Enron American Express T\u0026E Cardholders.  You may also find an enrollment form on the Enron Travel Program intranet @ gss.enron.com \u003chttp": "//gss.enron.com/\u003e.",
  "When you rent a vehicle in the United States, (including Puerto Rico) or Canada, the following insurance provisions are included, regardless of rate selected": "",

{
  "Consolidation of trading activity": "Mid- and back-office consolidation will see substantial progress prior to closing, such that only the front office / trading books will need to be combined at closing.  EES, NNG and TW have no real overlap with existing DYN activity, so there won't be much integration work required there.  The big integration effort will be ENA.",
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Date": "Mon, 12 Nov 2001 08:37:55 -0800 (PST)",
  "From": "Tucker, Patrick",
  "Lay": "had the SPEs been capitalized with perhaps $30MM more of risk capital, there would have been no question that they would have qualified for off-balance-sheet treatment and there would have been no need to restate earnings last week to reflect consolidation of the SPEs.",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c27768324.1075861696104.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",

{
  "Content-Transfer-Encoding": "7bit",
  "Content-Type": "text/plain; charset=us-ascii",
  "Core": "Wholesale energy business in North America and Europe, retail energy, pipelines",
  "Date": "Wed, 14 Nov 2001 09:47:31 -0800 (PST)",
  "Enron's business has been grouped into three buckets": "Core, Non-core, and Under Review.",
  "From": "Tucker, Patrick",
  "McMahon": "\"The company is overlevered; that's a fact.\"--hence our pursuit of additional equity.",
  "McMahon described the major off-balance-sheet vehicles": "",
  "Message-ID": "\u003c27189044.1075861696129.JavaMail.evans@thyme\u003e",
  "Mime-Version": "1.0",
  "Non-core": "Broadband, water, and international assets (i.e. EGAS).  Enron has approx. $8Bn in investments in these assets, and they have produced 'dismal' returns.  Enron will be exiting these businesses and will attempt to wind them up in an orderly fashion.  An aggressive divestiture program has been set in motion for these assets.",
  "Sent": "Wednesday, November 14, 2001 11:44 AM",
  "Subject": "Highlights from ENE Analyst Conference Call 11/14",
  "To": "Pollan, Sylvia S.; Culotta, Lindsay; Murrell, Russell E; Plachy, Denver; Cuilla, Martin; Storey, Geoff; Yawapongsiri, Virawan; Mahmassani, Souad; Donohoe, Tom; Ruscitti, Kevin; Shively, Hunter S.; Lewis, Andrew H.; Giron, Darron C.; Frihart, Bryant; Roberts, Linda; Luce, Laura; Hogan, Irena D.; Vickers, Frank; Williams, Jason (Trading); Mims, Patrice L.; Simpson, James; Hodge, John; Keavey, Peter F.; Mckay, Brad; Mckay, Jonathan; Pereira, Susan W.; Pimenov, Vladi; Ring, Andrea; Savvas, Leonidas; Townsend, Judy; Versen, Victoria; Barbe, Robin; Concannon, Ruth; Goodell, Scott; Jones, David; Kaiser, Jared; Loving, Scott; Bates, Kimberly; Muhl, Gil; Smith, Maureen; Smith, Shauywn; Taylor, Craig; Willis, Jim; Tucker, Patrick; McCaffrey, Deirdre; Penman, Gregg; Kinsey, Lisa; Brady, Kevin; Pendergrass, Cora",
  "Under Review": "EGM, EIM.  These businesses are being closely examined to determine whether they have a reasonable chance of long-term viability.  Required resource levels are being carefully studied.  Following review, Enron will move the different portions of these businesses to core or non-core as the analysis dictates.",
  "X-FileName": "JHODGE2 (Non-Privileged).pst",
